name: 1. Conduct continuity checks on all cables as per P&ID, and loop diagrams of a particular instrument loop.
2. Check electrical power supply to a specific instrument to confirm correct voltage (ac/dc)
3. Confirm earthing, shielding as per specifications and drawings
4. Programmable instrument, and values shall be recorded on test sheets as well electronic form.
ITR-I-17A Entec - Field Mounted Instruments Installation
template name: ITR-I-17A Entec - Field Mounted Instruments Installation

name: 1. Equipment has been received from the store in good condition and is the Correct type as per the site drawings, specifications & data sheets.
2. Check fixings/supports /clearances from other services, structures and de-mountable equipment are satisfactory
3. Check Instrument air / Impulse Tubing to spec is correct.
4. Check connection to correct process point/ instrument.
5. Instrument position orientation correct, properly supported. i.e. Stainless, steel, rubber lined
7. Instrument / cables correctly tagged, location as per drawings
8. Accessible from safe position, installed in correct height.
9. Flow direction correct, level probe length correct
11. Mechanical cable installation / termination method correct - i.e. special instrument cable, armoured and un-armoured cable.
14. Measuring element cable length within the maximum permissible length stated in the vendor data
15. Flange mounted / in line instrument correctly installed - i.e. gaskets, total no. of bolts, threaded elements fully screwed on.
17. Conforms to Specification and Drawings & As-Built Complete
18. Nuclear sources locked with shutter on close position / padlocked keys available
20. Confirm Area classification Ex, IP for materials, and devices
21. Signal isolator, junction boxes, trip wires adequate and installed
22. Devices and instruments protected by weather hoods
23. Devices and Instruments should be cleared off sources of heat and excessive vibrations (if not design for)
24. Installation drawings, locations drawings, cable schedules marked up "as built"
1. Check Instrument Nameplate details are correct in accordance with the instrument index.
2. Ingress protection is suitable for area. Instrument is suitably rated for area.
3. Instrument correctly mounted, orientation correct, elevation correct and free from vibration.
4. Instrument is accessible for maintenance and clear of obstruction and debris.
5. Vent lines are directed into a safe area.
7. Impulse, hydraulic, pneumatics, lines, air headers, correctly installed and supported.
8. In-line equipment installed and supported correctly.
9. Spare entries plugged correctly, using certified plug.
10. Instrument earthed in accordance with project specification.
11. Aspirator tubes and test gas tubes are installed and supported correctly.
13. EOL resistor fitted and correctly rated where applicable.
15. Spot check tubing has been reamed at connection points.
ITR-I-051 Entec - Stainless Steel Tube and Fittings
template name: ITR-I-051 Entec - Stainless Steel Tube and Fittings

name: 01. Tubing connection drawings and details available
02. Client site specific changes noted, agreed and sketched
03. Tube material type, size, gauge and standard confirmed and available
04. Tube fitting size and type confirmed and available
B. CHECKS DURING AND POST INSTALLATION
02. Correct thread tape and sealant used on fittings
03. Check fitting ferrule orientation and confirm prior to connection
04. Tube installation is in compliance with the client specification (Supports, Bracketry, Slope, Expansion, Vibration, Access, Cables)
05. Tube bent correctly, sufficient straight section into fitting
06. Tube cut clean and straight, de-burred, reamed, and blown through
07. Depth insertion tool used, witness mark visible at all stages of process
08. Tube fitting hex’s marked to ensure correct swage tightness
09. Random check with No Go gap gauge
10. In service leak test performed and passed
11. Fitting completion tag completed and applied to each fitting
